mountify_mounts.description:
Module mounting config.
0 - disable
1 - manual mode (mount modules that found on modules.txt)
2 - auto mode (mount all modules with system folder)

test_decoy_mount.description:
Test for decoy mounting.
This is meant for tmpfs mode.
0 - disable
1 - enable

mountify_stop_start.description:
Restarts android at service, certain modules might need this.
This is a workaround for 'racey' modules such as bootanimations and gpu drivers.
‚ö†Ô∏è if you do NOT have a problem, you do NOT need this

0 - disable
1 - enable

FS_TYPE_ALIAS.description: Change this if you have a customized overlayfs driver registered with another alias.

MOUNT_DEVICE_NAME.description:
You can put 'APatch', 'KSU', 'magisk' here so a zygisk provider can umount.

Examples: NeoZygisk, NoHello, ReZygisk, Zygisk Assistant, ZygiskNext-UM/DE

mountify_custom_umount.description:
Enable in-kernel umount methods here.
0 - disable
1 - susfs4ksu
2 - ksud kernel umount (22106+)

‚ö†Ô∏è if you have a zygisk provider, you do NOT need this

mountify_expert_mode.description:
üö® WARNING!
 ‚ö†Ô∏è This disables safety checks.
Mostly for development and debugging purposes.
0 - disable
1 - enable

use_ext4_sparse.description:
ext4 sparse mode override.
For tmpfs xattr capable setups that prefers using an ext4 sparse image to mount.
0 - disable
1 - enable

spoof_sparse.description:
Spoof sparse as an apex mount.
Goes well with a custom MOUNT_DEVICE_NAME.
NOTE: when this is enabled, nuking is disabled.

FAKE_APEX_NAME.description:
Customize spoofed apex mount name.
While futile, this tries to make it look legit.

sparse_size.description:
Set a custom sparse size.
Modify this to any unsigned number.
- sparse size in MB.

enable_lkm_nuke.description:
üö® WARNING!
‚ö†Ô∏è Experimental feature. Don't expect 100% success rate.
Loads a oneshot LKM that unregisters ext4 sysfs nodes. 
0 - disable
1 - enable

NOTE: on KernelSU 22105+ this is handled on ksud

lkm_filename.description:
Only GKI 5.10+ are properly supported.
Select your Android KMI.
